intro: Azaleastrum, commonly known as the evergreen azalea, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ericaceae family. It is native to the eastern United States, particularly in the coastal regions of North and South Carolina. The plant is characterized by its dense, glossy evergreen foliage and clusters of showy, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. Azaleastrum thrives in acidic, well-drained soil and requires partial to full sunlight. It is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
